results.title: Pirate ship
results.creator_credit: Frank Moser, Paul Terry and Castle Films
results.brief_description: Short animation with some live action and songs. A gang of pirates hold s young damsel hostage. She is rescued when the US navy sends a convoy of warships to destroy the pirates. They then sing a tribute to the glorious red, white and blue. Story is framed by having two characters of indeterminate species reading the story of the pirate ship. The female asks the male if he would rescue her they way the story hero recused the damsel. He says he would.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Moser, Paul Terry and Castle Films

results.title: Pippa passes = The Song of conscience
results.brief_description: Pippa’s singing it seems, has a magical healing effect on those who cross her path. Based on a Robert Browning poem, “Pippa Passes” has a time-based four-part structure and expressive simulation of early morning light. Cast includes Gertrude Robinson, George Nichols, Linda Arvidson, Mack Sennett. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: Piping hot
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Gas Council and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: Delightfully inventive treatment of the history of water heating. Reminiscent of “Romance of Transportation in Canada”, the visual, literal representation of straight commentary. Beautifully drawn and a decidedly funny cartoon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Halas, Gas Council and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films

results.title: Pipeline to the Clouds
results.brief_description: Shows the problems of water conservation and distribution. Animated cartoon show various means of finding and storing water. Reveals the wide use of water for industry. Suggests the establishment of nations ‘grids” of water pipes as a solution to the shortages recurring in many areas. Urges economy, mentioning that an average city can lose 500,000 gallons in a day through faulty plumbing.

results.title: Pipeline into Persia
results.creator_credit: Roland Stafford, Humphrey Swingler and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: A colourful account of the construction of the Ahwaz-Asna section of the Trans-Iranian pipeline. Received Honourable Mention at the Harrogate of Films in the Service of Industry, 1957.

results.title: Pipeline
results.creator_credit: Jack Fairbacher and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Describes the work in laying out a 500 mile long pipeline from new oil-field in West Texas and Mexico to Illinois. Illustrates the difficulties involved and the care with which the work had to be carried out to avoid damage to the pipe itself or its protective wrappings. Includes a shot of the dynamite explosions used to clear a passage for the pipe-line through rock, also unusual machinery developed for specialised tasks.

results.title: Pioneer journey to the Oregon country
results.brief_description: A re-enactment depicting pioneer life in the West from the pint of view of a 10-year-old boy who makes the journey to Oregon with his family, at the close of the period when the Appalachians were a barrier to westward movement. Life on the trail, religious activities of the settlers, and the dangers and hardships encountered.

results.title: Pintubi
results.brief_description: The Pintubi tribe of the Northern Territory still live nomadically by hunting and gathering, and have little contact with white Australians. The film shows how the Administration is attempting to help them. Music composed and played by Don Burrows, narration by James Dibble.

results.title: Pins and needles
results.creator_credit: Barbara A. Chobocky, Kim Batterham, Genni Batterham and Documentary Films
results.brief_description: An account of the emotional struggle of a 24 year old woman, Genni Batterham, who contracts Multiple Sclerosis and becomes a paraplegic in less than 18 months. The film examines the attitude and reactions of her parents, husband and society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara A. Chobocky, Kim Batterham, Genni Batterham and Documentary Films
